subclusters.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
Protein Aggregate Segregation and Spatial Quality Control Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in proteasome activity and its causal role in accumulation of damaged proteins and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes proteasome impairment as a driver of aging and cellular senescence, with experimental evidence linking proteasome function to longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights proteasome impairment in oxidative stress response and aging, with focus on proteasome assembly factors like Ump1.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteasome structural and functional decline with age, accumulation of ubiquitinated proteins, and modulation by caloric restriction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mechanisms of proteasome impairment and its causal role in aging through accumulation of damaged proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on proteasome dysfunction in T-cell senescence, linking impaired proteasome induction to immune aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Reviews proteasome dysfunction as a driver of aging and aggregation diseases, and benefits of proteasome activation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects oxidative damage to proteasome decline and accumulation of oxidized proteins as aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Decline and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links proteasome activity regulation by resource allocation and transcription factors to aging and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline of the entire proteostasis network including chaperones, proteasome, and autophagy as central to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on decline of proteostasis network and interplay with inflammation and oxidative stress in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details age-dependent decline of proteostasis network capacity and positive feedback loops leading to proteostasis collapse.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes proteostasis collapse in human senescence with impaired stress transcriptional responses and proteasome function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostasis derailment in cardiac aging including decline of chaperones, proteasome, and autophagy pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on proteostasis derailment as fundamental cause of cardiac aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers systemic and cell-nonautonomous regulation of proteostasis network decline as a fundamental aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on failure of proteostatic adaptations in cardiac aging, involving proteasome, autophagy, and mitophagy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostatic checkpoint in stem cells coordinating protein aggregate clearance and cell cycle arrest, lost with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits proteostasis collapse as nodal driver of replicative aging, linking chaperone exhaustion and asymmetric segregation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on chaperone occupancy balance as a switch controlling cellular senescence due to proteostasis imbalance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Aggregate Segregation and Spatial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on polarisome-mediated asymmetric segregation and retrograde transport of protein aggregates to maintain cellular age asymmetry.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Aggregate Segregation and Spatial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-dependent protein aggregation and insolubility as inherent aging process linked to proteostasis decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Transcription Error-Induced Amyloidogenesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on transcription errors generating mutant amyloid-like proteins that seed aggregation and promote aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes reactive protein oxidation products actively propagate damage and contribute causally to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Altered Protein Accumulation and Stability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Suggests accumulation of altered proteins with reduced stability and function drives aging, modulated by life maintenance processes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteome Stabilization and Reduced Turnover Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes longevity via proteome stabilization by trehalose and reduced protein turnover in daf-2 mutants.
